victims.bio: woman
tax office; from Ceyrat in Auvergene

victims.name: Stephane Albertini
victims.bio: Stephane Albertini operated a popular Italian restaurant in Neuilly-sur-Scene with his cousin, Pierre Innocenti. Both were killed at the Bataclan concert.

victims.name: Nick Alexander
victims.bio: Nick Alexander lived in London and sold merchandise for the band Eagles of Death Metal, which was performing at Bataclan. Alexander was killed at the concert hall.

victims.name: Amine Ibnolmobarak
victims.bio: Mohamed was newly marrried and was on the bar's terrace with his wife Maya when shooting started. He was killed, she is in critical condition. He was an architect and teacher at ENSA Paris-Malaquais architecture school and worked in Paris.

victims.name: Thomas Ayad
victims.bio: Thomas Ayad was originally from Amiens, France. He was an executive for Mercury Records, the French division of Universal Music Group, the label of Eagles of Death Metal. Ayad was killed at the concert with two friends.

victims.name: Maxime Bouffard
victims.bio: Maxime Bouffard was a film director.

victims.name: Quentin Boulanger
victims.bio: A Paris resident, Quentin Boulenger graduated from the Audencia School of Management in Nantes, France.

victims.name: Ludovic Boumbas
victims.bio: Ludovic Boumbas died shielding a female friend, who survived, when the shooting started at the La Belle Equipe restaurant. They were there to celebrate a friend's birthday. Boumbas was born in Congo and grew up in Lille, France. He worked at FedEx.

victims.name: Elodie Breuli
victims.bio: Elodie Breuil was a design student at Ecole de Conde in Paris. She had traveled from Boulogne to attend the concert with friends.

victims.name: Clair Camax
victims.bio: Clair Camax was killed at the concert hall; her husband Laurent survived. They have two children. With a degree in graphic arts, she started a design business for websites. She loved drawing, painting, comic books and rock music.

victims.name: Ionut Ciprian Calciu
victims.bio: Ionut Ciprian Calciu and Mariana Lacramioara Pop, his girlfriend, were killed by an outdoor shooter. They had one young son together; she also had a daughter.

victims.name: Nicolas Classeau
victims.bio: Nicolas Classeau was a director at the Institut Universitaire de Technologie in Marne-la-Vallee.

victims.name: Manuel Dias
victims.bio: Manuel Dias was working as a tour bus driver when he was killed outside the sports stadium by a suicide bomber. He had a wife and two sons and had lived in Paris for 45 years.

victims.name: Precilia Correia
victims.bio: Precilia Correia was killed with Manu Perez, her boyfriend, at the concert hall. She worked at a Paris electronics store. She was born in Paris; her father was Portuguese and her mother was French.

victims.name: Aurelie De Peretti
victims.bio: Aurelie de Peretti was a graphic designer and also worked at beach resort in St. Tropez. She loved music and went to Paris with a friend to attend the concert.

victims.name: Guillaume Decherf
victims.bio: Guillaume Decherf was a music writer for Les Inrockuptibles (Les Inrocks). He was the father of two daughters and was a former student at Loughborough University in England.

victims.name: Alban Denuit
victims.bio: Alban Denuit was an artist and earned his doctoral from National School of Fine Arts in Paris. He taught visual arts at University of Bordeaux-Montaigne.

victims.name: Asta Diakite
victims.bio: Asta Diakite was at the sports stadium watching her cousin Lassana Diarra, play soccer She had gone shopping earlier in day with a nephew.

victims.name: Romain Didier
victims.bio: Romain Didier was originally from Sancerre, a wine-making region of France. An amateur rugby player, he lived in Paris, where he was studying drama.

victims.name: Lucie Dietrich
victims.bio: Paris-based jewelry and graphic designer, shot in drive-by shooting by terrorist on Rue de la Fontaine au Roi

victims.name: Elif Dogan*
victims.bio: Elif Dogan was killed with her partner Milki Jozic at the pizzeria. They had been together for four months. She was from a Turkish family and was raised in Liege.

victims.name: Fabrice DuBois
victims.bio: Fabrice DuBois married with two children. He was a publicist and design editor for Publicis Conseil.

victims.name: Romain Dunet
victims.bio: Romain Dunet was an English teacher at a Paris high school and taught French in New Zealand in 2013. He was also a musician who played pop-rock tunes in Paris cafes and bars on open-mic nights.

victims.name: Thomas Duperron
victims.bio: Thomas Duperron was communications  director for the Maronquinerie Theater. He was raised in Alencon and lived in Paris.

victims.name: Mathias Dymarski
victims.bio: Mathias Dymarski and Marie Lausch, his girlfriend, were killed at the concert. He was a competitive BMX bike rider.

victims.name: Germain Ferey
victims.bio: Germain Ferey attended the concert with his partner and family members. He was killed after being separated from them when the attack began. His partner survived; they have a daughter, 17 months old. Ferey was a video producer and an audiovisual illustrator.

victims.name: Romain Feuillade
victims.bio: Romain Feuillade ran the Les cent kilos restaurant in Paris. He was also an aspiring actor.

victims.name: Gregory Fosse
victims.bio: Gregory Fosse was a music programmer for TV station D17. He was from town of Gambais in Ill-de-France.

victims.name: Alberto Gonzalez Garrido
victims.bio: Alberto Gonzalez Garrido was recently married. He was an engineer for the Spanish broadcaster TVE and had been living in Paris for two years.

victims.name: Suzon Garrigues
victims.bio: Suzon Garrigues was in her third year of studying modern literature at the Sorbonne.

victims.name: Veronica Geoffrey de Bourgies
victims.bio: A mother of two adopted children from Madagascar, Veronique Geoffroy de Bourgies was a former journalist for 'Madame Figaro' and 'Vogue Homme.' She founded and operated the Zazakely Sambatry, a humanitarian charity for children.

victims.name: Michelli Gil Jaimez
victims.bio: Michelli Gil Jaimez grew up in Tuxpan area of Mexico. She lived in Paris for 8 years and held Spain citizenship. She was due to be married in a few weeks

victims.name: Matthieu Giroud
victims.bio: Matthieu Giroud is the father of 3-year-old child. His wife is pregnant. He was a geography lecturer at University of Paris-Est Marne-la-Vallee.

victims.name: Cedric Gomet
victims.bio: worked for TV5 Monde; rock fan and a guitarist.

victims.name: Nohemi Gonzalez
victims.bio: Nohemi Gonzalez was a senior at California State University, Long Beach. She was an exchange student living in Paris.

victims.name: Anne Guyomard
victims.bio: Anne Cornet Guyomard and her husband Pierre-Yves Guyomard were killed at the concert hall. She was a music student.

victims.name: Pierre-Yves Guyomard
victims.bio: Pierre-Yves Guyomard and his wife Anne were killed at the concert hall. He taught film scoring.

victims.name: Pierre-Antonie Henry
victims.bio: engineer; father of two young daughters

victims.name: Raphael Hilz
victims.bio: architect from Paris, from Garmisch-Partenkirchen, Germany; eating at restaurant when killed

victims.name: Mathieu Hoche
victims.bio: France 24 news channel, tv station technician; had 6-year-old child

victims.name: Djamila Houd
victims.bio: worked for Isabel Marant, fashion house

victims.name: Pierre Innocenti
victims.bio: ran Chez Livio with his cousin Stephane Albertini, Italian restaurant in Neuilly-sur-Scene; both died at concert

victims.name: Milko Jozic
victims.bio: industrial engineer; from Liege; had daughter in her 20s. Was at pizzeria with Elif Dogan when they were killed

victims.name: Hyacinthe Koma
victims.bio: was celebrating birthday of Halima Saadi; worked as server at Les Chic Types

victims.name: Mariana Lacramiora Pop
victims.bio: killed outside café with partner Ciprian Calciu; celebrating birthday when attacked; had one young son together; she also had daughter

victims.name: Marie Lausch
victims.bio: girlfriend of Mathias Dyrmaski, both died at concert. She worked in international public relations at Coty; graduate of NEOMA Business School in France

victims.name: Guillaume Le Dramp
victims.bio: celebrating 33rd birthday at bar; worked in Paris as bartender

victims.name: Renaud Le Guen
victims.bio: service adviser at Man Truck and Bus France; loved jazz and rock; was to marry partner of 12 years next year

victims.name: Gilles Leclerc
victims.bio: florist in Saint-Leula-Foret; attended concert with girlfriend, who survived

victims.name: Christophe Lellouche
victims.bio: Christophe Lellouche was one of music composers for film "Yung Forever." He was also a guitarist and vocalist for Olivier, an independent pop band, and an avid soccer fan.

victims.name: Antoine Mary
victims.bio: computer programmer and developer; recently began freelance career

victims.name: Cedric Mauduit
victims.bio: council member from Calavados in Normandy

victims.name: Fanny Minot
victims.bio: editor at Canal + Supplement

victims.name: Lamia Mondeguer
victims.bio: dual French-Egyptian national;studied cinema; worked at Studio Noma talent agency as communications manager;

victims.name: Marie Mosser
victims.bio: Universal Music Group digital marketing specialist; spent last two summers in Brighton studying English

victims.name: Justine Moulin
victims.bio: she was having dinner with friends when she was killed. Was planning to visit family in Nieppe on weekend

victims.name: Quentin Mourier
victims.bio: architect at Atelier Grand Paris

victims.name: Victor Munoz
victims.bio: student at Paris School of Business; loved travel; lived in Prague for a time

victims.name: Helene Muyal-Leiris
victims.bio: make-up artist on fashion shoots; married with 1 child

victims.name: Bertrand Navarret
victims.bio: carpenter and avid surfer; was at concert on weekend trip to Paris

victims.name: Patricia San Martin Nunez
victims.bio: staffer for mayor of Sevran, a Paris suburb, mother, exiled from Chile under Pinochet; niece (Elsa was grandniece) of Chilean ambassador to Mexico

victims.name: David Perchirin
victims.bio: former journalist who became an elementary school teacher. Started work in the Seine Saint Denis area of Paris in September 2014

victims.name: Manu Perez
victims.bio: Universal Music Group

victims.name: Marion Petard Lieffrieg
victims.bio: sisters; Marion was musician and played the flute; killed while dining together on terrace

victims.name: Anna Petard Lieffrieg
victims.bio: sisters; Anna was graphic designer for Reporters Without Borders

victims.name: Caroline Prenat
victims.bio: graphic designer from Lyon

victims.name: Francois-Xavier Prevost
victims.bio: advertising chief for LocalMedia

victims.name: Sebastien Proisy
victims.bio: graduate of Ecole de Guerre Economique; recently started his own company

victims.name: Armelle Pumir Anticevic
victims.bio: print production manager at Logic Design Agency

victims.name: Valentin Ribet
victims.bio: graduate of London School of Economics; Lawyer with Paris branch of Hogan Lovells

victims.name: Estelle Rouat
victims.bio: English teacher at Gay-Lussac college in Colombes

victims.name: Thibault Rousse Lacordaire
victims.bio: worked as financial controller for Colony Capital

victims.name: Halima Saadi
victims.bio: killed with sister at restaurant; was visiting Paris for a week from home in Dakar, Senegal

victims.name: Houda Saadi
victims.bio: killed with sister at restaurant; was manager of La Belle Equipe.

victims.name: Kheirddine Sahbi
victims.bio: was walking home when killed; Sorbonne student, violin; studying music

victims.name: Lola Salines
victims.bio: member of Roller Derby team Le Boucherie de Paris

victims.name: Elsa Veronique Delplace
victims.bio: Elsa Delplace San Martin worked at management consultante Manegere; daughter of Nunez, has 6-year-old son; born in France; dual citizenship;co-founder of ProCreative, professor of economics at Universite Paris Quest Nanterre La Defense

victims.name: Hugo Sarrade
victims.bio: student in Montpellier; passionate about rock music and computers

victims.name: Maud Serrault
victims.bio: marketing director at Best Western

victims.name: Valeria Solesin
victims.bio: researcher and doctoral student at Sorbonne; was at concert with boyfriend; from Venice

victims.name: Fabian Stech
victims.bio: was art critic, translator and teacher

victims.name: Arianne Theiller
victims.bio: intern for Urban Comics, University of Strasbourg student

victims.name: Luis Felipe Zschoche Valle
victims.bio: chilean born resident of Paris; musician; lived in Paris for 8 years with French wife; was singer and guitarist for band Captain Americano

victims.name: Salah Emad al-Jabali
victims.bio: Egpytian national

victims.name: Eric Thome
victims.bio: art director of We Are Ted, a graphic design company; photographer

victims.name: Jean-Jacques Amiot
victims.bio: Jean-Jacques Amiot was a photographer and operated his own printing company prior to retirement last year.

victims.name: Chloe Boissinot
victims.bio: Chloe Boissinot and her boyfriend were at a restaurant when the attack began. She was killed, he survived. She came to Paris two years ago and was working in a pub. She also attended school in Chateau-Larcher in France, where she was studying management.

victims.name: Emmanuel Bonnet
victims.bio: Emmanuel Bonnet was a railway worker from Chapelle-en-Serval north of Paris.

victims.name: Baptiste Chevreau
victims.bio: Baptiste Chevreau moved to Paris from Tonnerre in central France in September. He was a music illustrator.
